title: Explain why diffraction only observed small scale

content.question: Louis de Broglie proposed that all forms of matter have both wave properties and particle properties. Which of the following explains why diffraction effects are observable only for small-scale objects?

choices.label: Wavelengths of large-scale objects are much smaller than any aperture through which the objects could pass.
Wavelengths of large-scale objects are much larger than any aperture through which the objects could pass.
Large-scale objects have too much energy to allow observation of their wave properties.
Large-scale objects move too slowly to allow observation of their wave properties.

content.answer: Wavelengths of large-scale objects are much smaller than any aperture through which the objects could pass.
